answers.answer: I have never taken a glucose test. And both my sons are perfectly healthy.. I don't think I would be too worried about not being able to take it
Thank goodness, I've been so worried and no one has rushed to answer my questions so I was freaking out. Thank you so much

R u high risk ? Like is there ppl in ur family thats diabetic ? I failed my 1 hr w my first and passed the 3 hr somehow ... Yet when he was born he had dangerously low blood sugar ... This pregnancy i failed 1 hr took 3 hr and failed i have to keep track of my sugar and take a pill .. i never imagined id have high sugar but i do its a good idea to try to take it again if u have fam members that have it jic cuz it can harm ur baby but its ur choice momma

When i was induced w my first i had to wait because a lady had gestational diabetes was 36wks n needed an emergancy c section because her baby was 10lbs and wasnt responding and had to b sent out that constintly goes through my mind because i dnt want that to b my baby but it could happen to anyone
Uncontrolled gestational diabetes increases risk for neonatal morbidity and mortality. I highly suggest you get screened/tested. Sometimes a mom that is low risk for GD gets it.

question: I went to do my glucose test at 25wks and 3daysI threw up in the middle of drinking the nasty drink and they told me I needed to come back and do it again before I'm 28wksI've been working everyday 8am-5 and I had no time to come into the doctor again and I'll be 28wks on Monday ...I got on my patient portal and asked the nurse what I should do and she never answered so I called today and i am still waiting for a call back...is this going to put my baby in danger????
title: What's gunna happen??
